Info: Core shape does not conform to categories below
A core with flakes typically struck from a platform, while the opposite surface is held against an anvil, creating impact damage (e.g. crushing) on the distal surface
Discoidal, high-domed core with step and hinge fractures along a single, circular or ovate, platform
Parallel elongate flake scars, each 2x longer than width, on a typically very small core (<10cm). Used to produce bladelets as a component for geometric microliths and backed blades
Produced from a flake that is similar in form to a burin, but with bladelets removed from the proximal end
